page.title: 08HOUSING IN THE BERROW AREA
page.content: Housing in the area is made up of large old farmhouses, small cottages with gardens and some modern houses and bungalows.All houses have mains {electricity:}there is no main{gas supply but bottled gas is available. Most houses have{mains water}but a few still depend on{pumped water from {wells.}In general, the houses and cottages are owner-occupied but a few are rented from large private estates which stretch into this area.A{council {housing estate}is found in Rye Street.All alterations to existing houses go through the District Planning Office in Malvern, and there are no new housing estates contemplated as it is a restricted area for new buildings. There are no slums in the area.
